alert.note: Alert for Orange County Coastal; San Diego County Coastal Areas (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued December 27 at 5:32AM PST until January 01 at 2:00AM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM THURSDAY TO 2 AM PST MONDAY... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 6 to 12 feet. Highest sets to 15 feet in southern San Diego County. * WHERE...San Diego and Orange County Beaches. * WHEN...From 8 AM Thursday to 2 AM Monday. * IMPACTS...Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. Minor tidal overflow during the morning high tides at vulnerable low-lying coastal areas such as beach parking lots and walkways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...High tides at La Jolla: Thursday 5.9 feet at 904 AM. Friday: 5.7 feet at 939 AM. Saturday: 5.3 feet at 1014 AM. Sunday: 4.9 feet at 1051 AM.
info.instruction: Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions.

area.areaDesc: Orange County Coastal; San Diego County Coastal Areas
